{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481716,"name":"ATEMS Robotics","username":"ATEMSRobotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/atemsrobotics/{size}/235307_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T03:24:07.882Z","cooked":"

Our team is wanting to do a climb like Ri3D’s Donut climb for Reefscape. We want to use 2 Kraken X60’s with MaxPlanetary Gearboxes (We’ll add the proper spacers). Penn State said that they used 225:1, but on the REV website REV mentions 225:1 ratios are not allowed. Is this a suggestion from REV or a rule in FRC. Also in this scenario which gear ratio should we use?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T03:24:07.882Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":154,"reads":296,"readers_count":295,"score":849.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481574,"topic_slug":"maxplanetary-climb-ratio","display_username":"ATEMS Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68717,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/maxplanetary-climb-ratio/481574/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3481720,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T03:27:31.150Z","cooked":"
ATEMSRobotics:

but on the REV website REV mentions 225:1 ratios are not allowed. Is this a suggestion from REV or a rule in FRC

It’s not an FRC rule.

However, when a manufacturer of a product says “you shouldn’t set this up this way, as you will exceed the load rating”, it’s generally a good idea to listen, as if it breaks when you use it that way it’s entirely on you.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T03:27:31.150Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":292,"readers_count":291,"score":103.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481574,"topic_slug":"maxplanetary-climb-ratio","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/maxplanetary-climb-ratio/481574/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3481722,"name":"ATEMS Robotics","username":"ATEMSRobotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/atemsrobotics/{size}/235307_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T03:28:21.995Z","cooked":"

So what ratio(s) do you think can withstand the load that are recommended.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T03:35:18.102Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481574,"topic_slug":"maxplanetary-climb-ratio","display_username":"ATEMS Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68717,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/maxplanetary-climb-ratio/481574/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3481724,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T03:32:47.687Z","cooked":"

I recommend using Recalc for finding the ratio you want and then double-check to see if that ratio is within the manufacturer’s recommendation for the gearbox. Worst case you could add another motor and gearbox or come up with a different way of doing the mechanism like adding a reduction through some chain.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T03:32:47.687Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":69.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481574,"topic_slug":"maxplanetary-climb-ratio","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.reca.lc/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"ReCalc","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/maxplanetary-climb-ratio/481574/4","custom_user_title":"1646M 2851A ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3481785,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T04:33:44.869Z","cooked":"

REV recommends a max ratio of 144:1 (using the newer 9:1, or 125:1 without), but that doesn’t account for an external chain/belt stage. You could do 75:1 (5/5/3) feeding to a 3:1 reduction via chain or belt. That would give you 225:1 and stay within REV’s recommended configurations.

But I’ll echo the recommendation for ReCalc (or other mechanical design calculator tool). It’s entirely possible you don’t actually need a ratio that high.

How would I put this scenario into Recalc and what would I be looking for. None of the functions look like they are telling me ratios depending on load

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T05:27:54.108Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":50.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481574,"topic_slug":"maxplanetary-climb-ratio","display_username":"ATEMS Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59796,"username":"Arrowmag","name":"Joey Tidrow","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68717,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/maxplanetary-climb-ratio/481574/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3481824,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T05:44:30.122Z","cooked":"

Because the ratio IS part of the calculation in Recalc, you’re going to need to put a ratio in.

So, let’s say you’re doing a linear lift. You have a “load” cell. Put a robot weight in, let’s just say 150lb. Pick your motors, including quantity. Set the other parameters as you like. Pick a reasonable number for the gear reduction and see if it seems like it’ll make sense.

Here’s an example I whipped up really quick that WON’T work–I did that intentionally so you’ll need to play around. How do I know it won’t work? Pulls way too much current, though the time might have something to do with it. It’s also using a bit too small of a motor.

I may or may not have also linked an example that’s much more likely to work somewhere in this sentence. That’s so you get the answer after you play around a bit with the calculator. There may be other applicable calculators in Recalc as well, but I’ll leave you to find those as homework.

Yeah, it’s certainly best not to exceed the load rating of the product… Oops…

PXL_20250109_0705185681920×2550 498 KB

Caused by a Falcon 500 with a 45:1 Versa Planetary gearbox on Quaxly’s climber. The max ratio in the load rating guide is 30:1

What ratio was that stage? Doesn’t look like the 9:1 to me (and shouldn’t be. Higher numbers should be closer to the motor)

Yeah, high backlash + heavy arm = not fun. We had a heavy arm with a lot of backlash and a quick change in direction during testing caused a loud pop sound. The arm still worked for a bit afterward because we thought it just hit the hard stop and did some tuning to not cause that. But a bit later we noticed that thing.
